main event: A solid shimmery object was observed descending and then disappearing from radar in Lexington, Massachusetts on May 15, 1962.
interesting points: The object was visible on radar for about 20 minutes,It descended from about 32,000 feet to 9,000 feet before vanishing,The object appeared as a small intermittent blip on the radar scope,Conditions were likely clear at the time of the sighting,The report details an eyewitness description of the object as solid and bright.
witness description: An actual eyewitness and a graduate of Harvard College, Mechanical Engineer.
